intro: Clerodendrum lanceoliferum, commonly known as the lanceleaf chaste tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Clerodendrum lanceoliferum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
